content.question:
The temperature, in degrees Celsius (<math> <semantics> <mo>°</mo> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaeyiSaalaaa@37E0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>C), of the water in a pond is a differentiable function W of time t. The table above shows the water temperature as recorded every 3 days over a 15-day period.

(a) Use data from the table to find an approximation for W'(12). Show the computations that lead to your answer. Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text:
The temperature, in degrees Celsius (<math> <semantics> <mo>°</mo> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaeyiSaalaaa@37E0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>C), of the water in a pond is a differentiable function W of time t. The table above shows the water temperature as recorded every 3 days over a 15-day period.

(a) Use data from the table to find an approximation for W'(12). Show the computations that lead to your answer. Indicate units of measure.

(b) Approximate the average temperature, in degrees Celsius, of the water over the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>15</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> days by using a trapezoidal approximation with subintervals of length <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>Δ</mtext> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8qacqqHuoarcaWG0baaaa@3873@</annotation> </semantics> </math> = 3 days.

(c) A student proposes the function P, given by P(t) = 20 +10te(-t/3), as a model for the temperature of the water in the pond at time t, where t is measured in days and P(t) is measured in degrees Celsius. Find P'(12). Using appropriate units, explain the meaning of your answer in terms of water temperature.

(d) Use the function P defined in part (c) to find the average value, in degrees Celsius, of P(t) over the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>15</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> days.

topic.text: 2.3: Estimating Derivatives of a Function at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
